meanings.definition: To regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: She overidealized her new job, thinking it would be flawless.
meanings.sent2: He always overidealized his favorite sports team, expecting them to win every game.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's tendency to overidealize situations sometimes led to disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The movie overidealized the concept of love, making it seem unattainable in real life.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement overidealized the benefits of the product, exaggerating its effectiveness.

meanings.definition: To have an excessively idealistic view of something.
meanings.sent1: They overidealized the idea of a perfect vacation, imagining everything going perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overidealize relationships, expecting them to be flawless without any effort.
meanings.sent3: His overidealized view of the world sometimes made him seem out of touch with reality.
meanings.sent4: The book overidealized the concept of heroism, making it seem unattainable for ordinary people.
meanings.sent5: The painting overidealized nature, portraying it in an unrealistically perfect light.
